DADOS-GERAIS.NOME-EM-CITACOES-BIBLIOGRAFICAS: ROMBOL, A. D.;Rombol, Adamo Domenico;Rombol, Adamo;ROMBOLA, ADAMO DOMENICO;Rombola, A.D;ROMBOL, A.D;Rombolaa, Adamo D.;ROMBOLA, ADAMO D.;ROMBOLA, ADAMO D.;ROMBOL, A.D.;DOMENICO ROMBOL, ADAMO;Rombol, Adamo D.;ROMBOL, A.D;ROMBOLA, A. D.;ROMBOL, A. D

RESUMO-CV.TEXTO-RESUMO-CV-RH: Adamo Domenico Rombola' got the master degree cum laude in Agricultural Sciences at the Faculty of Agriculture of Bologna University with a thesis in Farm Organization and Management, title "Effects of Common Agricultural Policy's Reform on farm decisions". PhD degree in Fruit Trees and Woody Plant Sciences, Thesis "Physiological and biochemical aspects of iron nutrition in Actinidia (Actinidia deliciosa). He is Researcher at the Department of Agricultural Sciences of Alma Mater - Bologna University, Professor of the course Viticulture Management and Secretary of the Bachelor Degree of Viticulture and Oenology of Bologna University. He has the National Scientific Habilitation as Full Professor in the sector 07/B2 - Science and Technology of arboreal and forestry systems. He gave courses of Fruit Trees Growing abroad. Tutor of the Thesis of 50 students. Co-Tutor of the Thesis of 20 students. Tutor of 2 PhDs, Co-Tutor of 5 PhDs attending PhD courses abroad (3 of them in Brazil), Tutor of 12 Post-docs and Internship of 130 students and researchers. Twelve times Member, abroad, of Evaluating Committees for International PhD courses. Farmer and small producer of organic wine and olive oil. His main research areas are: 1) AgroEcology, 2) plant response mechanisms to abiotic stresses; 3) nutrition and soil management of fruit tree crops, 4) development and management of Highly Sustainable Agricultural Systems, 5) improvement of quality and healthiness of fruits and wines, 6) organic and biodynamic viticulture, 7) physiology and canopy management of training systems for grapevine. He participated and coordinated national and international research projects. He published more than 150 papers, 50 of which in international IF Journals, 2 book chapters and participated as invited speakers to international simposia. Convenor of the Conference AgroEcological Viticulture and Biodiversity. The efficient use of natural resources (Monte San Pietro, BO, 2017). Convenor of the Events: Spring School of AgroEcology (Drapia, VV, April 23-25 2018); "Summer in AgroEcology" (Drapia, VV, August 3-6 2018); "Autumn in AgroEcology" (Drapia and Tropea, VV and Mirto Crosia, CS, November 1-4 2018). Invited speaker and Member of the Scientific Committee of the International Conference on Raw Materials to Processed Foods (Antalya, Turkey, April 11-13 2018). He was Member of the International Scientific Committee and the Editorial Board of the "VII International Symposium on Mineral Nutrition of Fruit Crops" (Chanthaburi, Thailand, May 2012). He has been secretary and member of the scientific and editorial board of the "National Symposium on Fruit Tree Crops Nutrition" (Bologna, 2005), Member of the editorial board of the International Symposium ISHS "Foliar nutrition of perennial fruit plants" (Meran, 2001). He is member of the Australian Society of Viticulture and Oenology (ASVO), the American Society for Enology and Viticulture (ASEV), the International Society for Horticultural Sciences (ISHS), the Italian Society of Horticulture (SOI). He is referee of several international Journals (Australian Journal of Grape and Wine Research, Plant and Soil, Plant and Cell Physiology, Plos one and others). Academic Responsible (UNIBO) for the International Cooperation Agreement with Belgrade University (Serbia). Member of the Overseas Committee - Bologna University. Responsible of several cooperation agreements with Foreign Universities and Research Centers. Coordinator of the International Project PASS (Participatory AgroEcology School System). Some Collaborations in Brasil: UFPel (Pelotas, RS), UFRGS (Porto Alegre, RS); UNICENTRO (Guarapuava, PR); IFRS (Bento Goncalves, RS); UDESC (Santa Catarina, SC); UNESP (Ilha Solterira e Botucat. SP). He participates in the project Capes-Print "Produo de Alimentos de Alta Qualidade" (2018-2022), coordinated by UNESP.
RESUMO-CV.TEXTO-RESUMO-CV-RH-EN: Doctorate at Agronomia from Universit di Bologna (1998). Has experience in Agronomy, focusing on Phytothecnics, acting on the following subjects: Agroecologia, nutrio mineral, manejo de solo e de canopia, viticultura, olivicoltura, fruticultura

OUTRAS-INFORMACOES-RELEVANTES.OUTRAS-INFORMACOES-RELEVANTES:
PhD in AgroEcology with emphasis on Highly Sustainable Viticultural Systems
-Development of highly sustainable soil management strategies in vineyards for enhancing carbon sequestration, water use efficiency and growers incomes. -Physiology and development of innovative canopy management strategies (winter and summer pruning, late trimming, late defoliation, etc.) of grapevine. -Organic and biodynamic viticulture. -Characterization of grapevine seed oil and leaves from vineyards under organic and biodynamic management. -Berry physiology and prevention of ripening disorders (berry dehydration, shrivel, sunburn, decoupling between technological and phenolic maturity). -Physiological, biochemical, molecular and agronomic aspects of nutrition in grapevine and fruit trees. -Development of animal-blood based fertilizers for plant nutrition of grapevine in organic farming. -Silicon nutrition of grapevine for improving berry and wine quality, storability and tolerance to environmental stresses. -Improvement of grape and wine quality through sustainable agronomic approaches. -Rootstocks and varieties responses to abiotic stresses (nutritional stresses, Al and Mn toxicity, Mg deficiency, heat stress, etc.). -Development of innovative methods for assessing berry quality. -Valorization of local grapevine and olive varieties.

PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.NOME-DO-PROJETO: POTENCIAL DO USO DE RESDUOS DA INDSTRIA VINCOLA NA PRODUO ORGNICA DE UVAS PARA O MANEJO DA COBERTURA VEGETAL, DE PRAGAS E DOENAS
PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.DESCRICAO-DO-PROJETO: A utilizao de recursos subaproveitados, com o objetivo de aumentar a produtividade e criar riqueza, ter de merecer, cada vez mais, a ateno do setor vitivincola. O tratamento de subprodutos agrcolas entrar crescentemente na pauta de prioridade do setor agorindustrial, tendo em vista o seu aproveitamento, a despoluio do ambiente e, em muitos casos, e sempre que possvel, com ambas as finalidades.Os resduos slidos do processo de industrializao da uva, quando mal dispostos so agressivos ao meio ambiente. Tais resduos liberam quantidades significativas de efluentes lquidos, quando dispostos no solo, sendo que este lquido contm alto teor de nutrientes, matria orgnica e outros elementos que, podem alterar o meio, principalmente de arroios e fontes, causando a morte de seres aquticos.No entanto, se bem utilizados podem se constiturem em matria-prima para outras finalidades. Os resduos slidos da uva processada industrialmente e que podem ter algum interesse econmico potencial so o engao, o bagao, sementes, material filtrado dos lquidos (borra) e outros.O bagao o principal subproduto da vinificao, no s pela sua riqueza alcolica e tartrica, mas tambm pelo interesse econmico de alguns dos seus componentes fsicos. O bagao, como do conhecimento geral, o produto resultante da prensagem das massas vnicas, constitudas pelas partes slidas das uvas e pelo mosto ou pelo conjunto mosto/vinho que as embebe. O bagao constitudo principalmente por gua, cerca de 60-70%; vinhos e borras, sendo estes dependentes da prensagem; lcoois, principalmente o etanol, e tambm o metanol, glicerol e alcois superiores; aldedos, steres, cidos volteis, polifenis e taninos, protenas, celulose, pectinas, sais minerais e resduos de acar.Considerando a produo nacional de uvas destinada industrializao de cerca de 710 mil toneladas de uvas (IBRAVIN 2011), descontando-se o engao que representa at 7% do peso dos cachos, estima-se um volume d

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS:
The Conference aims to be a forum for the presentation of new advances and research results in the fields of Biodynamic agriculture.
The Conference will bring together leading academic scientists, researchers and scholars from around the world, and give occasions for interactions between scientists, experts and practitioners.
Do not miss this important meeting which will take place in Conegliano (Italy), August 27-30 2015.
Please visit the conference website: www.icoriba.org.
Adamo Domenico Rombol
